headline: Here Are All House Members Russia Didn’t Sanction
author: Kipp Jones
sentences: Others who were not sanctioned are Andrew Barr (R-KY); Steny Hoyer (D-MD); James McGovern (D-MA); William Keating (D-MA); Chris Smith (R-NJ); Frank Pallone (D-NJ); Tom Malinowski (D-NJ); Albio Sires (D-NJ); Gregory Meeks (D-NY); Jerry Nadler (D-NY); Richard Hudson (R-NC); Warren Davidson (R-OH); Marcy Kaptur (D-OH); Michael Turner (R-OH); Brian Fitzpatrick (R-PA); Joe Wilson (R-SC).

“These individuals, including the leadership and committee chairmen of the lower house of the U.S. Congress, are placed on the Russian ‘stop list’ on a permanent basis,” the ministry said a press release.
In response to what were called “anti-Russian sanctions” imposed on 328 deputies of the Russia’s federal assembly, the country announced sanctions against 398 members of the House.
Russia further ignored California Democrats Mike Thompson; Jackie Speier; Eric Swalwell; Adam Schiff; Anna Eshoo; Zoe Lofgren; Brad Sherman; Ted Lieu and Maxine Waters.

Other members of the House who avoided the ire of Russian legislators include:
Republicans Reps. Mike Rogers and Barry Moore, both of Alabama.
CORRECTION: This article originally stated Rep. Greg Stanton (R-AZ) was not sanctioned by the Russian government, but in fact he has been.
Illinois saw Reps. Adam Kinzinger (R-IL), Raja Krishnamoorthi (D-IL) and Bradley Scheider (D-IL) spared being banned from Russia.
Republicans and Democrats from across the country were ignored by Russia — and there appeared to be no rhyme or reason as to why.
The Russian Foreign Ministry announced sanctions on most members of the House of Representatives on Wednesday.
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) was ignored, as was House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.
Rep. Gus Bilirakis (R-FL) was left off Russia’s list, as was Rep. Ted Deutch (D-FL).
People such as Reps. Lauren Boebert (R-CO) and Mo Brooks (R-AL) were on the list.
What is surprising is the House members who were not targeted by the sanctions.
So, too, were Reps. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) and Rashida Tlaib (D-MI).
In total, 398 House members were targeted by retaliatory sanctions.
One Georgian, Democrat David Scott, was also not targeted.
Most of the House was targeted by Russia’s government.
Rosa DeLauro (D-CT) was also not sanctioned.
